page.title: 03LONGTON'S TRADE AND SHOPPING
page.content: The shops in this block are mainly one man owned shops. The various families have owned the shops for many years although the premises have been altered or rebuilt. When Longton was beginning to grow, in the 1960's, most of the shops were in converted houses or wooden sheds. The{plumber}had his base in a wooden garage behind his house, the{electrician}had a wooden shed full of fridges, television sets and radiators. The{shoe shop}is the only business still trading from a wooden building and the insurance for this is almost prohibitively high. There is now a unit of shops, purpose built in the village centre, which includes a bank and shops, with offices and service shops on the upper storey. The{Post Office}is still in a converted house with a live in family.
